column4: Can anybody give me a hand with a wireless problem I'm having?

I'm on a laptop with wireless. Ubuntu automatically used a driver that I know works, but I can't see any wireless networks. I know at least 4 people with the same exact laptop (they are handed out by my uni) and they see them just fine with the same driver and everything. Any ideas?
what do you get if you type iwconfig?
...does it recognize your device?
caravel do you have a dell?
i have ath0 and wifi0, wifi0 has no wireless extensions, but ath0 does, but when i do a scan for networks it says none are found
it also lists eth0 and lo, with no extensions of course
How do you scan did you try sudo iwscan ath0 list
yeah
and my utility doesnt list any
Are you using the mad-wifi drivers?
lucid
no, but i know my driver works. same one works on other laptops exactly like mine. i checked. one strange thing is that i can't ifdown and ifup on ath0. it says its not configured...
luciddr3am3r it sounds like your driver is not properly installed, did you use a modprob ...?
didnt do modprob
How did you install the drivers.  When I used the mad wifi drivers I had to do modprob "???" at the end
the drivers were automatic
I also have an atheros wireless card.
loaded them on install
just like my roomates with the same laptop
i even compared to make sure we were running the same driver
Well you got me there then, I think the drivers are included with ubuntu, but when I did it on my old laptop (with the atheros card) they weren't so I install mad wifi manually
someone had me edit a few lines of my /etc/network/interfaces file. would anything there contribute?
what does it say.  Mine has two lines it it that aren't commented out.
